reviews.review_msg: Darren is a great professor. He really keeps you engaged during lectures and his assignments mixed with the feedback improved my writing ten-fold.
Darren is the best instructor I have ever had at SFU! Don't listen to the posts which say he is bad! He is funny and cares a lot. I saw him in office hours every week and was always helpful.

Loved his energy, you can tell that he genuinely cares about the content. Course is hard, but I genuinely think he is the best option. His feedback on assignments were vague and sometimes he would not want to meet for office hours. TA SUCKED AND MARKED SO HARD. Final assignment required us to print over 20 pages which sucked.

Darren's writing course was frustrating. Instructions were vague, and expectations kept changing. Feedback on assignments was minimal and not actionable, making it hard to improve. The grading felt inconsistent. Even though the topics had potential, the lack of clear guidance made the learning experience discouraging.
Darren is a nice person, but he won't help you succeed in the course. Lectures are unclear, feedback is minimal, and you're mostly on your own. WORST TA!
Darren's lectures lacked structure and clarity. Assignments often felt unrelated to the material, and grading was inconsistent. Minimal feedback and poor communication made the course frustrating.

Darren is the funniest professor I've ever had. 

Across the board BUS360W is not a light course load, and you can't avoid the fact that every teacher and TA is a tough marker. However, when you go to Darren's class you genuinely feel that he cares for your learning and the dad jokes are a great bonus.

Darren really cares about his students. He has a PhD in Communication and it really shows in his lectures. He is extremely approachable and does a great job helping students learn important skills. Take the class with him, I promise you won't regret it.
Such a supportive and down-to-earth professor. Makes class feel less stressful and more engaging. Definitely one of SFU's best!
Amazing prof! He truly cares about students and makes the course clear and stress-free. Always approachable and willing to help. One of the best I've had at SFU!

He's truly one of the kindest and most supportive professors at SFU. He genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed, not only in the course but also beyond. His passion for teaching is truly evident, and he makes 360 feel much more approachable and even enjoyable. One of my favourite profs at Beedie for sure.

He is the kindest Professor out there, who cares for his student and wants them to learn and succeed. He is definitely one of my favourite professors here in sfu. I would recommend taking him for 360, since he makes it more enjoyable and tolerable! Make sure to use office hours to you're full advantage and ASK FOR HELP AND ADVICE!!!!!
Wow! I enjoyed his class, he is so nice and is the best choice for this difficult course! Highly Recommended!
Darren is the best prof for BUS 360W
Darren is very kind and funny. His classes are hardly graded, but thats honeslty just the way BUS360w is setup. Definitely would recommend him as a professor.
Darren is hilarious! He keeps lectures fun and fast paced so it is easy to pay attention.  If you found Bus 217 hard, take 360 with Darren as he is much better than the 217 instructors.

The best professor I have had at SFU. He creates a very good atmosphere in class, he throws in a few dad jokes. He genuinely wants to help his students improve on their writing. The course is designed to be a slightly heavier workload but Darren gives sufficient time to to do the work and get some feedback before submitting the final work.

Darren is one of the best profs I have taken at SFU. I highly recommend taking BUS 360 with him. He makes lectures interesting and entertaining. He is a fair marker, the average in his class tends to be higher than other BUS 360 profs and considering it is not a curved class that's a good thing. Overall, he is a very nice prof.
Darren is a very hard marker - but he is super funny! Who doesn't like a good dad joke!

Bro is a elite prof that balances his history as a caseit coach alongside the 360w content 

His content is relevant to the industry without being impractical and ignore the comments him being too harsh he just keeps it real and wants to improve ur grasp of the English language and business vocab so u rep beedie school of business well in his eyes
Tough but fair looking back
Great prof teaches bus com well
Can honestly say i improved A LOT. Should've probably prioritize this class above everything else tho

His favour words are "there are 20 mistakes in yours sentence, but I will not tell you what it is because it is not an English calss." Not helpful, high expectation, tough marking, students should avoid taking his class.

never gave any professors a low rating in my life except for Christian. He won't appreciate your effort and time for this course.So, don't expect a good grade by just always visiting his office hours for help. still got tons of red ink by following exactly his/TA's feedback. So inconsistent and disappointing!fun lecture but cruel grade.
Having no interest to deacribe this guy. If you take his classes, good luck!
The worst prof I have ever had. He chooses the groups himself and seems to purposely try to fail certain people. Marking is very unfair and subjective. Do not take 360 with him!!
Although, I did not do very well in this class. Christian is an amazing prof. He really wants to help you do well. Attend his office hours early on to ensure that you get the help that you need.
He is the meanest teacher ever I had in SFU, do you have problems with Asian student? Horrible experience, don't ever want to take his class again.

Everything you hear about this course is true. If you are not proficient in the english language and don't have good grammar, don't bother taking this course-you'll only make yourself and your teammates suffer. Do revisions throughout the semester. Start early on work!!!!!!!! Pay very close attn to directions. Txtbook is awesome-I'm keeping mine!
I rate this professor with fairly poor grade because he don't know how to treat his students with respect. His office hour is not helpful at all!

I heard he is the easiest 360 prof, it is so not true!!! He and his TA marks entirely different, which makes it extremely confusing to do the revisions. And he can always find something wrong with your work!!
Very good prof. Always making jokes in class to make everything more relaxing.

He is a really good instructor. The course was pretty tough but he made it looks so easy. He has some sense of humor, which made the class not boring. Taking this class with him is highly recommended.

Awesome Prof. My writing skill has really improved after this class. It is one of the most useful class I took in SFU. The course itself is tough with some serious workload. It is high recommended for those joint majors who wants to improve their business communication skills.

Christian is a great lecturer. He is enthusiastic and has the ability to keep me somewhat interested through the 3 hour lecture. He is always willing to help students when approached. The class itself is a LOT of work and graded very hard.

Christian is an excellent professor, who is very clear and engaging. The course itself is a lot of work, but very useful! I would say one of the most useful business courses I have taken. Would definitely recommend this course with Christian!

He is a very good professor. He is very clear and knows how to keep the class interesting. There are a lot of assignments that you re required to do but I found the course really helpful. Excellent teacher!
Very nice! :) This course requires a lot of work, but it is very useful and Christian just makes it so much more enjoyable!
he's a great prof. I recommend you guys to take this class with him.

He's really nice and willing to help students if they need it. He's not a marker but TA, so if you want to get high grade, go find your TA and ask him/her. This course looks tough, but it's very fun and enjoyable class. You don't pick your own group but he will assign you a group. Good Luck everyone! Overall He's awesome!

Insanely hard marker. He does help you improve your writing skills, but he's so picky, even having the slightest spelling error can cause a failing grade. The consulting presentation is extremely difficult and almost feels impossible because there's just so much information to know and he'll find some fault in it. Portfolio = easy marks.

Kevin is very knowledgeable, and basically built this course. He may come across as arrogant at first, but he cares about his students, and wants them to succeed (might not always seem like that). Very difficult to do well in his course, but if you follow his instructions precisely, write concisely and attend his office hours, you can do well!

BUS 360 is a hard course in general, but I recommend Kevin. His feedback is very clear and his lectures are very helpful as well. The TA is the best support line so definitely meet with them about assignments and the group project. Make sure to follow instructions!! Worst thing is that he doesn't use Canvas, but its not that bad.

Without a doubt the worst teacher I experienced in my post secondary education. Conceded, and arrogant. 

Since graduation, I've worked many years in business, and this class proved to be a very obvious waste of my time. Kevin's obsessive attention to irrelevant details are not applicable to the real life.

Kevin's feedback is very detailed and helpful. However, he is an extremely harsh grader and has unclear grading rubrics. Kevin takes a very long time to get assignments back and does not have office hours. do not recommend There are weekly group assignments that you have to present to either him or his TA, and assignments are very time consuming.

Bus 360 in general isnt an easy course. Kevin's office hours were really helpful, be sure you sign up for office hours as much as possible to get his feedback on assignments. Tip for the course is to be very detail oriented.

This class could have been a workshop; instead they make you hundreds of dollars for it. Grading is tough and it feels like he is telling everyone there is only one way to communicate in the business world. Btw, say goodbye to 40% of your grade if your group doesnt work well with you.

Expect a ton of work, but to get a lot out of it. MAKE SURE TO GET A GOOD GROUP or else your grade will suffer. I would have gotten an A if it wasn't for my group. If you're not a detail oriented person, you might want to check yoself or avoid the course. Get used to writing PERFECTLY!

Kevins brings valuable experience from the real world.  The business writings are real life applications.  Business is a tough field, and he lets you know you can't make mistakes because there is no 2nd chance.  One of the toughest class I have taken. But you learn so much.  To pass, you have to think critically from all perspectives.

Kevin is a great prof. He is very clear about the course materials and you do see your writing skills improve throughout the semester. He also has a lot of respect to his students and is very willing to help. But, this class is extremely hard, especially for ESLs. Take a GPA booster to balance your term grade.

There's no where to find help in this course. I always wait 1 hr in line to see him in his office hr and only usually get 1 Q answered. TA (Rachel) was not useful at all ether. Writing mentors are terrible-I'm not even sure how they get hired. Unless you are a naturally gifted business-style writer, you're pretty much screwed for this course =(
BUS 360 is still a pain for me, although years have passed. The marking is unfair at all!

Kevin is great, he really respects his students and want them to do well. He is a harsh marker, but real. He works in the real world and therefore has a realistic expectation and this material you can use when you start working. You learn tons in this class in terms of professional image. TA michelle is useless though, she treated me like i'm dumb.

Brilliant guy, he really knows what he's teaching. Given the material, the lectures were really interesting and somewhat engaging. You will spend hours pulling your hair out at the assignments but it is a really good, practical course and you learn a lot. Oh, and going to his office hours is a must if you don't fully understand some things.
put great effort on this course and you will learn a lot, but please remember getting a B is a really good job for this tough course, and notice that many ppl need to retake this course.

If let me say the one thing I learned from Kevin, it has to be "kids, life is never fair".No matter how hard you try, I go to his office twice a week. I see mentor, TA for help. I spend 20 hours a week on a single page assignment. I do not think I will get more than a B. Several times, he told me to write certain things and when I got the assignmen
Detail, detail, detail! And go to his office hours... all the time.

If you go to his office hours he'll basically tell you what you need to do to get a good mark, especially for the group project. The only problem is that he can be condescending and rude when you speak to him one on one, so you walk away feeling stupid and put down. Other than that, he's a very consistent marker and you'll learn a lot in his class.

Despite what others wrote, Kevin is always available for help during his office hours for extra help. If you go see him he'll pretty much tell you exactly what to write to get an A and explain why the alternative is effective. The material is really useful for work after school. SUPER important to get a good group for the project!
He's super anal. Can I say that?

I got the feeling that he loves teaching, but only because he felt he was better than everyone else.  The course is useful, because of the writing skills employed, but he made it a living hell.  I swear he stands in front of his mirror every morning and says "I am greater than everyone else" because hes an extremely cocky guy.

I think that whenever Kevin marks an assignment, he has a 'perfect document' in mind which he marks against. A very closed-minded person. To be sure you do good in his class, you basically have to know exactly what he wants. DO NOT TRY TO DO SOMETHING NEW & DO NOT TRY TO BE CREATIVE. Be "CRITICAL" means say what he wants you to say

People trashing Stewart are just bitter. This was by far one of the most useful classes in this faculty - as you may or may not recall, the majority of our Business Admin student body has little to no writing skills. He's a great prof and has a lot to offer.

Great teacher. Hard course. I thought he was extremely clear with his requirements. He made an extensive amount of help available to the students. As long as you've got decent writing skills, and are willing to change bad habits, you'll do fine in the course.

One of the worst proffessors I've ever had.  Very unclear with his expectations, very picky.  THe only good examples of writing he could give were his own, even when giving previous work as examples of how assignments should be done, he later told us that these examples were not good and we shouldn't use them as templates or guides
He's too picky about everything and I personally do not think his class is useful.
worst prof ever! unclear of his expectations, you pretty much figure them out as low marks roll in. trust me take it with another prof!
kevins class was the worst experience of my life, he is rude, unhelpful and unfair!
Marks really hard and gives too much work for a 3 credit course.
I despise his arrogance.

Usefull class. Kevin teaches in a way that makes you actually do things and re-do them, which is great practice. Hard marker, quite demanding, even comparing to my boss at the office where i work. But, again, he strives for perfection in business writing and encourages students to do the same. Tough but worth it.
Nothing good I would like to share.
The only course which i hate so much. The only prof that I think needs a lot more education on how to respect students.

This prof always puts on a bad attitude, he takes his pride in punishing his students, as if this is his purpose for teaching. I just dont think he really qualifies as a instructor, strongly recommend him leaving the department and find another career.
he is not helpful at all, grading is so subjective ....avoid him if you could

Not useful at all. Loads of guideline sheets, unprofessional lecture slides, and many assignments. But no time to think about what you are doing. At the end, you know, more or less, how to write an assignment for Kevin, but you didn't get writing skills.
you don't get writing skills, at most you get passing BUS  360 skills.

i just wanna say that...Kevin, our expectation in taking this course is to learn communication skills and apply them, not to experience an additional torture in gettin' used to your own teaching/grading method.
he knows what he's talking about but he doesn't too a great job getting students to apply it   the way he wants.  take it with somebody else.

Very subjective, and he's not clear at all on how a mark is derived. I've done well in the class, so I guess I can't complain too much. Final exam was the easiest I have ever written in my life (spelling, grammar, vocab, simple MC). If i were to take it again, I wouldn't take it with him. He's frusterating to deal with.

Mr. Stewart knows his stuff, and will help you improve your writing if you really want to. Probably the hardest class I've taken, just follow examples to the dot, no creative formating, just understand conventions and use big words he gives you. Really good teacher, the class is something everyone needs whether you like it or not.

Although he's clear and he knows what he's talking about, he's SO ANAL about little things and you totally don't know what to expect from him until you get your grades back.  He always tells stories to prove how successful he is, and he's very condescending towards the students like he's so superior.  Overall, bad attitude / vibe from him.

this class requires lots of writing, thatz fine
 but being marked by a VERY SUBJECTIVE prof, it becomes an issue; If your work doesn't meet his expectation(but you never know what he expects), and does not follow ALL the rules, then itz time to prepare for registering the class again.....
No Comments
the class is good but the prof is questionable. He's very boring and like others have said not helpful in terms of what he expects. I'd advise you to wait til someone else is teaching this class.

He clearly does know what he's talking about. What alot of people don't realize it that in business one tiny mistake can cost you big time. He makes you understand this and with a few C- assignments you'll pick it up quickly.

At the beggining I thought he was great...now after 3 months in the class i'm not so sure. Not clear as to what he wants. Has his own convention which he does not explain well. Too much time wasted in personal anecdotes that show how good he is instead of clarifying what he wants.

learn alot in his class. He has very specific expectations and requires you to write in a standard structure. I think this course is really helpful. However, his markings are quite hard. Overall pretty good prof
Not a bad prof.. just a little bit too much work.  Tends to be a little bit full of himself.  However, you'll probably be able to take away something from his classes for use in the real world.
This class provides good practical skills necessary for communication in the corporate world.
No Comments
If you are interested in learning how to speak English, take an ESL class.
The guy is not a fair marker. A+ paper in other sections get D- in this class.
A mean person. Follow his convention strictly instead of business convention.

I've learned so much from taking this course. The marking can be tough but the instructor is always reasonable and the class is overall very valuable. I hope people who can't speak english can actually start learning the language by taking this course.
I am paying $600 to sit through this terrible course for 13 weeks.  I want a refund.
Very hard to approach and is quite unhelpful. Hate the class!
tons of work for this class and he is pretty hard. Be prepared. I hate the quizzes..is useless.
UGH!!!! I hate him and his corny as jokes. His class makes you realize how unimportant school is!

Tough marker.  But very helpful and has a good sense of humour!  If you have a good group, it's not too difficult to get an A- overall.  Don't be hurt if you only get a B- in your first assignment: you'll definitely go uphill from there on.  Great class.
lots of writing
easy easy easy, people have been lying about how tough Stewart is.
So good, so easy, so good, so easy.
the final was easier than i expect, just study his note, dun need to study from the textbook. just hate those pop quizzes. but u can surely learn a lot in this course.

This is one of the best courses offered in the Business program and it truly delivers what it guarantees, i.e. that over the 13 weeks your writing skills improve. Kevin is an excellent Prof,with a great sense of humor. People say he's hard, I disagree.
No Comments
Useful class but very very difficult. Really hurts the GPA.
picky
Tough marker but definitely one of the best, most practical courses I've ever taken.
Too much information.  Extrememly useful class and decent lectures, but soooo much to learn.  Pickiest marking ever come across.
No Comments
smart, nice, tough marker, never stop talking in class, helpful
picky prof, but extremely useful course... take it !!
Classes were painful, but a year later, still using techniques, thx Kevin!
lectures were very long and drawn out.  standards for marking were unclear.
No Comments
Difficult course, but very useful.
No Comments
Knows his stuff, but boring class. Always available to
nice guy, answers email fast, good class but difficult
Tough marker. Helpful class. Looks like he came right from an 80's sitcom..
This was one of the most useful business classes I've taken.  Kevin is awesome!
No Comments
one of those guys who thinks his writing is better than everyone
No Comments
No Comments
Picky, and he'll ask you to aviod using "picky" because it's "negative word"
No Comments
a really smart guy, I learned a lot from this course
Interesting class; kept me awake at 9:30 am; picky marker
really nice, good teacher, talks too much in lectures
solid prof

A lot of people will say that Leanne is a very hard prof to take 360 with but for me it was the opposite. Trust me, she makes the class very easy on students and she was always open to helping you understand what you did wrong in your assignments. Yes this course is a lot of work but she try's to make it manageable. class was always engaging too
very tough, but you learn a lot from her. easily the most applicable class taken in the business major.
Shauna is very very bad

Shauna knows what she's doing. This isn't a course where you memorize facts. You can't be lazy and have to work. It's a practical course and not theoretical (which doesn't teach you anything in business). I had to work hard, but at least I learned something useful.

If you are ESL students,AVOID her!Don't expect her to help you improve your writing because she makes tons of mistakes.Doesn't care about her job and students.She's inconsistent with her marking.Cocky,impatient,and unprofessional. Ironic to have a prof like this to teach business communications.SFU HR department's epic fail!

A real business course compared to the courses where you memorize the textbook. Must work hard every week if you want to do well. Make sure to use resources effectively. (ie. TA, writing mentors, library)
Her grading for assignments usually starts at A-. In general, fair grading and very nice.

Take the old reviews of her with a grain of salt. Im pretty sure she's read these things and changed stuff. She is SUPER nice! I would recommend her! The reality of the situation is that you DO have to put the effort into this class...she honestly is very helpful and if you want a good grade you do need to see her or a TA for revisions.

MAKE FRIENDS WITH YOUR TA! TA office hours are a lifesave for this course, Shauna is a TOUGH grader and very inconsistent. Nit-picky, and plays favorites so you might want to speak up in class. Also, put some effort in, as ridiculous as she is sometimes, the abilities you can gain are actually important (more so then any other course I've taken).
Shauna is a great professor if you want to learn how useful a class will be for you.
Horrible prof, stay away! Her marking is inconsistent and picky as hell. Honestly, she talks about her "success" 80% of the time. Teach us, don't brag. If you want to fail, take this prof.

Where do I start? Plays favourites with the hardcore suck ups. Doesn't know jack about the whole business process. If you want to be a professional secretary, then you should take 360 with Shauna. Oh, how did I almost forget the insanely unclear guidelines that goes with every assignment? Doesn't know how to weigh assignments either.
Too useless lectures, wasting more than half of the class time doing useless activities. Never teaches student how should write but expects students to figure out by reading textbook.
Shauna is very helpful prof! I would definitely recommend her! YOu can learn a lot from her!!!

An absolutley horible prof!!! Quite possibly the most useless person ever. An extremely poor attitude towards students, excluding the few that were willing to put countless hours into sucking up. She goes on about writing business reports for clients; if she is so good at her side job maybe she could spare us her egalitarianism and quit teaching
No Comments
Shauna is a great lecturer! She is very helpful & wants everyone to do well. itz just a matter of ur work effort and quality to c if u can make the grade. Definitely recommended!

Shauna is a great speaker. She makes lectures interactive & FUN which is a huge improvement over most BUS classes. Guidelines are a little unclear, so make sure you clarify with her, and GO TO OFFICE HOURS--She definitely "favours" the people who make an effort!
she is nice!
She's not as bad as everyone said, just be nice to her and she'll be nice to you...
she is good.. strong communication skills

AVOID! Disorganized and sloppy herself but expects absolute professionalism from students. Treats students like children (ie: rings bell to get attention). Very subjective marker with little usable feedback: even if you correct your errors, your marks don't improve as she will just find more errors. Recomm taking anyone else. Not worth the headache

She marks just as hard as Stuart, so don't take it with her to avoid him. Unorganized, instructions are cryptive. Can't take any negative feedback or suggestions. Not recommended. Will lecture you on how to dress professionally, but doesn't have a clue herself. Avoid this one.
She is a decent prof. The course does require ALOT of work, but is usefull. She could coordinate this course a lot better if she did it on her own, and not try to follow stewart.

She blames the students for not reading the instructions when it's her own instructions which aren't clear. When half the class doesn't get the instructions, it usually isn't the students' fault. She marks incredibly hard and subjective. Never know when you're too wordy or not enough detail. Patient was much better when he guess lectured.

Nice teacher, but is not organized. To do well, must revise a lot & must see the TA/Shauna for feedbacks. This is a SUBJECTIVE course; different ppl read your work differently, thus, it just not how good you write, it's who reads it and how it affects them. She does make a lot of typos in her handouts. It's ironic b/c this a communication course.

Com'on..she is TERRIBLE. talks like a highschool teacher in class but a bossy b*tch in office hours. Doesn't teach much but requires A LOT from you. Unclear of what she wants. Always making changes. Very FAKE. the TA is better than her... Expects too much from students when she herself is a very disorganized, last-minute person who makes lots typo

what are you guys talking about? she's the most disorganized prof I have Ever had.  Not to mention utterly boring, a horribly hard marker, and basically cocky, with a very 'impersonal tone'.  Marking, as mentioned, is extremely difficult, and she likes things a certain very SPECIFIC way. if you do anything else, you will be harshly penalized.
Great prof. Really enthusiastic with her work. Best advice is to revise your work EARLY. go see the TA or the Prof regularly for your revisions.

Well, this is a course which you have to put in your best effort. Marking is tough, so prepare to get some disappointments. Although the class got 3 outlines, shauna is helpful and clear. This course is not as easy as i thought but it's very practical.

Easy course if you have the time to dedicate to it. Always do your revisions on assignments. Course was slightly disorganized, but is practical and full of material that you'll probably one day have to use.

Great instructor even though she had to make many changes to the course. Business Communication isn't easy so you can't expect to get many A's. She's way better than Patient (had him as a sub 2 times) and Stewart (my friends had him)... so, I recommend taking BUS 360 with Jones.
No Comments

Sucks that your grad is heavily dependent on group .she makes you choose your own in the first 2 weeks which was really awkward, Look for good-groupmates!. No textbook was used. all lecture based, her slides are excellent. and make sure you write good notes on them. She really tries her best to make you succeed. Overall I definitely recommend her!

Listen to me: if you have to take 336, take it with someone else. Every Wednesday when I had to sit 3 hours in his class, I learnt NOTHING. By the end of the semester I was so annoyed of his awful jokes and his useless class. The fact that he makes all his exams MC is also ridiculous. Save yourself some frustration and take it with someone else.

Eric is nice, super helpful and wants his students to succeed. He is a tough grader but gives amazing feedback. Read the instructions carefully and you will do well in his class. I highly recommend taking BUS 360 with him.

Although categorized as one of the harder classes in beedie, Eric made 360 very enjoyable and rewarding. Despite my struggles in the past with writing and being in ESL, this course has definitely improved my business writing etiquette.

One of the best business professors at SFU! He is very helpful and gives lots of chances/ opportunities for students to improve their writing. If you put in the effort to go to the office hours and take the feedback from TA/prof, you will def get a higher grade.

Eric is super nice and really cares about his students. He's a hard marker but he's fair and will help you in any way he can to get the mark you deserve. He's super approachable and classes are engaging. definitely take 360 with him if you can

After four years at SFU, Eric is seriously one of my favourite profs. He's picky about using business conventions but reasonable and always very willing to help and give feedback. In fact, he stayed after class to answer everyone's questions on their assignments.

Eric has been one of the best professors I have ever had! He always provides quality feedback, even if it means taking time out of his busy schedule. He is a fair marker and will consider your input if you have concerns about grades. I highly recommend him if you truly want to improve your English writing skills and want to hear honest feedback!

Eric was by far one of my favorite instructors at SFU thus far. He is always there for you when you need help and replies to his emails very fast. I was able to improve my professional writing a lot from him. Very fair marker and as long as a student puts in the time and effort to improve their writing, it is easy to get a good mark.

Eric is one of my favourite professors in SFU. Although this class is difficult by itself, I improved a lot in my professional writing gradually with Eric's help. I definitely recommend taking this course with him.

Eric Tung is one of the best instructors I've run into at SFU. He has a lot of consulting as well as teaching experience, so go to lectures and pay close attention to his words. This class is not easy, but he genuinely cares about your learning and effort. His passion for the subject is also very admirable. Plan well for the final submission!

Eric is a fantastic instructor. Very clear and offers lots of help. I enjoyed taking the class with him. This is not an easy course, but if you attend office hours and get feedback, you can do well. Marking is tough. However, Eric offered me lots of suggestions and guidance and I noticed a marked improvement in my writing by the end of the course.
Average

I can't decide if I like her or not. Whenever I write assignments while following my intuition, I get good grades from her, yet when I write assignments using her advice, my grades go down by 20%. Her teaching methods are fine, but she should give more credit to the textbook. GET FEEDBACK ON YOUR ASSIGNEMNTS BEFORE HANDING THEM IN!!!

Make no mistake about it, this course is as tough as you've heard. While you may be shocked at your initial marks, if you follow her (rather specific) feedback you will see an improvement in your marks. Always well prepared for class, handouts are provided and the lecture flows smoothly. If you need help, be sure to sign up for office hours early.

Chantal is one of the best prof's I've had in my three years at SFU. She is very passionate about what she does and genuinely cares about her students. She is motivating and does all she can to help you. This course is alot of work, but Chantal makes it very bearable.
